summary:
Bermuda is a group of 181 islands in the Atlantic Ocean, named after the explorer Juan de Berm√∫dez. It was first settled by the English in 1612 and became a British colony. The islands have a tropical climate and are known for their beautiful beaches and coral reefs.

Bermuda has a long history, with a parliament that dates back to 1620. It was an important naval base for Britain and is now a popular tourist destination and financial center. The people of Bermuda are diverse, with many of African, European, and Native American descent.
title: Bermuda
